meanings.definition: The state or quality of being near in space or time.
meanings.sent1: The nighness of the mountain made it seem within reach.
meanings.sent2: The nighness of the bus stop was comforting after a long walk.
meanings.sent3: The nighness of the weekend brought a sense of relief to the students.
meanings.sent4: The nighness of the deadline loomed over the team like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The nighness of the storm made everyone rush to secure their belongings.

meanings.definition: The closeness or proximity of something.
meanings.sent1: The nighness of the trees provided shade on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: The nighness of the neighbors made it easy to borrow sugar.
meanings.sent3: The nighness of the siblings led to many shared secrets.
meanings.sent4: The nighness of the finish line motivated the runners to sprint.
meanings.sent5: The nighness of the concert stage made the fans cheer louder.

meanings.definition: The imminent approach or arrival of something.
meanings.sent1: The nighness of the train signaled the end of the journey.
meanings.sent2: The nighness of the storm clouds hinted at rain to come.
meanings.sent3: The nighness of the holidays brought joy to the children.
meanings.sent4: The nighness of the exam made the students study harder.
meanings.sent5: The nighness of the guests made the host prepare extra food.
